message: Basically, PSP games remastered in full HD, PS3-exclusive content and even sharing of saves between PSP and PS3. This is a pretty exciting announcement. I'm hoping for Peace Walker.

This is great news. A couple of weeks ago, there were some rumours about a remastered compliation of Chains of Olympus and Ghost  of Sparta for the PS3, so I'm sure they'll be next. Peace Walker is also on my wish list. Have never owned a PSP, so this will all be new to me.

This is fantastic news. As someone who's almost bought a PSP a number of times for a handful of games (including the God of Wars) I'm ecstatic. Two words though:

Crisis. Core.
Speaking of, where's that PSN FF6 already? :\
Probably in the same uncertain state of being as the PSN Store :P
Since they're initially targeting Japan with this product line (in fact, the Remasters have *only* been officially announced for Japan thus far), I'd say Crisis Core is probably a safe bet.
I'll be over the moon when that happens.
Perhaps the details of the full line-up will be revealed at E3. *crosses fingers*
I'm not overly excited about this, but Peace Walker would be great with that second analogue stick.
Monster Hunter people, you guys really need to play it. :) Crisis Core is also definitely something I'd be interested id.
